Incident_Title: File upload failing for ChatGPT users
investigating_description: We are currently investigating an elevated file upload errors affecting ChatGPT users
identified_description: The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
monitoring_description: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Incident_Title: Elevated Errors in API
resolved_description: We experienced a brief period of elevated errors for API requests between approximately 10:45 AM - 11:15 AM PT.

Incident_Title: Elevated Error Rate for ChatGPT and API
investigating_description: We are currently experiencing elevated error rates for ChatGPT. We are currently investigating.
identified_description: We have identified the root cause of this issue, and are currently working to implement a fix.
monitoring_description: We have implemented a fix for all API models with the exception of 'gpt-4-1106-preview', which we are continuing to work on. We are continuing to monitor performance for across all APIs as well as ChatGPT, and will post an update as soon as able.
resolved_description:
This issue has now been resolved.
Starting at 10:20am PT, customers experienced elevated errors on ChatGPT and API.
ChatGPT was mostly recovered by 11:55am PT, with some free plan customers continuing to experience issues until 1:20pm PT.
API performance was recovered for most customers by 1:30pm PT, with a smaller number of customers continuing to experience issues until 3:45pm PT.

Incident_Title: ChatGPT currently unavailable
investigating_description: We are aware of an issue which has resulted in ChatGPT being unavailable. We are currently investigating and working to restore functionality as soon as possible.
identified_description: We have identified the root cause of this issue, and are currently working to implement a fix.
monitoring_description: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring results. Most users should already see access to ChatGPT restored.
resolved_description: This issue has now been resolved. Between 4:06pm and 4:30pm PT, ChatGPT was unavailable to all users. Access was restored to most users by 4:34, with a small number of customers still experiencing issues until 5pm.
postmortem_description:
On November 8th, 2024 from 4:06 PT to 4:41 PT, a large portion of ChatGPT traffic failed with 503 response codes. For most of the duration of the incident – from 4:06 PT to 4:32 PT –  this affected requests from the web client, OS-specific application clients, and iOS devices. The Assistants API also experienced errors.
The root cause was a configuration change to the load-balancing configuration for a downstream service which ChatGPT depends on. This config change activated a latent bug in the logic to actuate the config, rapidly increasing server worker’s memory usage which led to all of them crashing.
Once we identified the root cause, we mitigated the outage by rolling back the configuration change. By 4:32 the errors had almost completely subsided, and service was fully recovered by 4:41.
To keep the system safe in the short term, we have already done the following:
Locked the configuration in question.
Audited all places where the configuration is read.
In the coming weeks, we will significantly refactor our configuration delivery systems to prevent this class of outage from happening again:
Use property testing to verify that our configuration parsing libraries perform as expected across wildly varying inputs, especially those which library authors do not foresee.
Implement gradual rollout of configuration changes.
Create faster configuration rollback mechanisms.
We know that extended API outages affect our customers’ products and business, and outages of this magnitude are particularly damaging. While we came up short here, we are committed to preventing such incidents in the future and improving our service reliability.

Incident_Title: Increased errors for ChatGPT
investigating_description: We are currently investigating an increased rate of errors for users of ChatGPT
identified_description: We have identified the root cause of the issue and are working on implementing a fix
monitoring_description: A fix has now been implemented, and we're monitoring impact. Most formerly impacted users should already be seeing improved performance.
resolved_description: This incident has been resolved. The issue started November 7, 2024 at 9pm PT and ended November 7, 2024 on 11pm PT.

Incident_Title: Workspace Analytics Unavailable
identified_description: Starting at 2:30pm PT on Monday, Nov 4th, the workspace analytics page has been unavailable. We have identified the root cause and are currently working on a fix. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.
monitoring_description: We have now implemented a fix to make the workspace analytics page available again. If you are still unable to access that page, you should be able to soon.
resolved_description: This incident has now been resolved and all customers should be able to access the workspace analytics page. Thank you for your patience.

Incident_Title: Latency and errors across the Intercom application
investigating_description: We are currently investigating latency and errors across the Intercom application, which is impacting our Help Center functionality. Users may experience delays in responses.
monitoring_description: Between 2024-10-31 15:52 UTC and 2024-10-31 16:11 UTC today, some customers might have had trouble contacting OpenAI support through the help center. We are monitoring for recovery.
resolved_description: This issue has now been resolved. OpenAI services including the API and ChatGPT were unaffected.

Incident_Title: Login failures for OpenAI services
monitoring_description: Starting from 05:35AM PDT, users may have had difficulty logging in to OpenAI services. Login errors have returned to normal levels but we're continuing to monitor.

Incident_Title: Some customers cannot reach support services.
identified_description: We expect the situation to be remedied shortly. There is no impact to ChatGPT or the API.
resolved_description: Between 02:53AM and 03:34AM PDT today, some customers might have had trouble contacting OpenAI support through the help center. This issue has been resolved. OpenAI services including the API and ChatGPT were unaffected.

Incident_Title: Degraded performance for the Assistants API
investigating_description: We are currently investigating this issue.
resolved_description: This incident is now resolved. This took place on Saturday October 19, 2024 from 12:33pm to 1:19pm Pacific time.

Incident_Title: Billing and Usage dashboard data not displaying for some users
identified_description: We are currently investigating an issue where multiple users have reported no activity appearing in their billing and usage dashboards for certain models since October 10, 2024. Affected API customers are still able to use our models without disruption. Starting from ~1 PM PT today, users should start seeing data reflected again.
monitoring_description: We have implemented a fix for a configuration error which caused this issue. That fix is live so now the billing and usage dashboard data should be displaying normally for all who should have access. We're monitoring a backfill of all related billing events to ensure the usage display since this issue started reflect correctly in customer dashboards.
resolved_description: This incident has been resolved. The issue started October 8, 2024 at 11:00am Pacific and ended October 17, 2024 on 12:40 Pacific.

Incident_Title: Increased latency in the API on GPT-4o mini
investigating_description: We are currently investigating increased latency on our GPT-4o mini model in the API. ChatGPT does not appear to be impacted at this time.
monitoring_description: We believe the issue has been mitigated. We're continuing to monitor the performance of this model.
resolved_description: We've implemented a fix and confirmed the elevated latency on GPT-4o mini is resolved. This started Saturday Oct 12 11pm PT and resolved on Thursday Oct 17 3am PT.

Incident_Title: Users are currently unable to upload files in ChatGPT / custom GPTs or in the API / Assistants

monitoring_description: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. The fix is applied to all impacted services across ChatGPT, custom GPTs, the API, and Assistants.
resolved_description: This incident is now resolved across all impacted services. This incident started Thursday October 17th, 2024 at 10:21pm and was mitigated at 10:45pm Pacific time.

Incident_Title: API Account Activation on Credit Purchases
investigating_description: We are investigating reported issues where some API Customers are not having their accounts properly activated after purchasing credits. Engineers are investigating.
identified_description: We have identified an issue preventing some API credits purchased through a payment method requiring 3DS authentication to fail to be applied. Our engineers are working to resolve this issue, and impacted credits will be applied as soon as possible.
resolved_description: We have deployed a fix for this issue. Only a very small cohort of brand new users using 3DS was impacted, and were not properly activated when they first purchased credits. Those users have had their access restored, and all purchased credits have been properly applied.
